medi:segment.name: Beginning of message
medi:segment.medi:documentation: BGM, A segment for unique identification of the Superannuation Contributions Advice Message, the type of Superannuation Contributions Advice and its function.

medi:segment.name: Reference
medi:segment.medi:documentation: RFF, A segment for referencing information related to the whole message. The scheme/ plan number is mandatory. In addition, the employer number and other references, such as references to payments, may be provided.

medi:segment.name: Payment instructions
medi:segment.medi:documentation: PAI, A segment specifying the payment means (e.g. cheque or direct bank transfer) and, if required, the payment channel for the Superannuation Contributions Advice. The payment conditions may also be specified.

medi:segment.name: Currencies
medi:segment.medi:documentation: CUX, A segment giving the currency and the associated exchange rate of the total amount paid in relation to this advice.

medi:segment.name: Financial institution information
medi:segment.medi:documentation: FII, A segment identifying the financial institution (e.g. bank) and account number of the issuing party, and, where required, the receiving party.

medi:segment.name: Date/time/period
medi:segment.medi:documentation: DTM, A segment which may include the message date, the payment date, the cheque date, the date and time associated with any validation keys, and other dates relevant to the whole of the message.

medi:segment.name: Payment terms
medi:segment.medi:documentation: PYT, A segment to indicate payment terms applicable to the whole message, such as the number of periods covered by the contributions advice.

medi:segment.name: Free text
medi:segment.medi:documentation: FTX, A segment for free text information in coded or clear form, to give further clarification when required to the Superannuation Contributions Advice message. It should be noted that the use of clear text may require special processing of this segment.

medi:segmentGroup.medi:documentation: Segment group 1: A group of segments identifying names and addresses relevant to the Superannuation Contributions Advice.

medi:segment.name: Name and address
medi:segment.medi:documentation: NAD, A segment identifying the name and address of the parties associated with the Superannuation Contributions Advice and their functions. Examples are: the employer, the recipient system and the name and address of the payer's financial institution if required.

medi:segmentGroup.medi:documentation: Segment group 2: A group of segments identifying contact persons or department and their communication number.

medi:segment.name: Contact information
medi:segment.medi:documentation: CTA, A segment giving additional contact information of a person or department specified in the NAD segment and to whom communication should be directed.

medi:segment.name: Communication contact
medi:segment.medi:documentation:
COM, A segment specifying communication contact number.
4.1.2 Detail section
Information to be provided in the Detail section:

medi:segment.name: Section control
medi:segment.medi:documentation: UNS, A service segment placed at the start of the summary section to avoid segment collision.

medi:segmentGroup.medi:documentation: Segment group 3: A group of segments identifying member and employment details.

medi:segment.name: Name and address
medi:segment.medi:documentation: NAD, A segment providing the member's identification number, and, if required, the member's name, title, and work address details.

medi:segment.name: Attribute
medi:segment.medi:documentation: ATT, A segment providing the member's sex type.

medi:segment.name: Reference
medi:segment.medi:documentation: RFF, A segment for identifying the member's payroll number or an associated reference.

medi:segment.name: Date/time/period
medi:segment.medi:documentation: DTM, A segment providing the member's birth date.

medi:segment.name: Employment details
medi:segment.medi:documentation: EMP, A segment providing required employment details of the member, such as the member's employment category.

medi:segment.name: Place/location identification
medi:segment.medi:documentation: LOC, A segment providing the member's work location identification.

medi:segment.name: Free text
medi:segment.medi:documentation: FTX, A segment for free text information in coded or clear form, to give information on additional attributes if required. Coded text should be used where possible, as the use of clear text may require special processing of the FTX segment information.

medi:segmentGroup.medi:documentation: Segment group 4: A group of segments identifying contribution processing details. Any date details may be provided in either segment group 4 or in segment group 5, depending on requirements.

medi:segment.name: Payment terms
medi:segment.medi:documentation: PYT, A segment giving the number of payment periods associated with the contribution, and, if required, the payment frequency (as part of the type of period). The payment terms type qualifier needs to be used to indicate whether regular or other (e.g. advanced payments) contributions are involved.

medi:segment.name: Monetary amount
medi:segment.medi:documentation: MOA, A segment providing the member's salary.

medi:segment.name: Currencies
medi:segment.medi:documentation: CUX, A segment identifying the currency and associated exchange rate of the member's salary and contributions.

medi:segment.name: Date/time/period
medi:segment.medi:documentation: DTM, A segment specifying the contribution start and end dates, and the date of any contribution termination.

medi:segment.name: Free text
medi:segment.medi:documentation: FTX, A segment for free text information in coded or clear form, to give information on additional attributes if required. Coded text should be used where possible, as the use of clear text may require special processing of the FTX segment information.

medi:segmentGroup.medi:documentation: Segment group 5: A group of segments identifying member contribution amount details and their type. Dates may be provided in this segment group where needed. An investment instruction may also be provided as required.

medi:segment.name: Contribution details
medi:segment.medi:documentation: COT, A segment to qualify the nature of a contribution (e.g. a normal, special or a final/ceasing contribution), and the type of a contribution (often mandatory) such as member or company paid. Conditionally, the segment may provide an investment instruction, and give the reason for a change in contributions as indicated by the contributions qualifier and the monetary amount (e.g. a final/ceasing contribution has been made).

medi:segment.name: Monetary amount
medi:segment.medi:documentation: MOA, A segment giving the contribution amount paid for or by the member.

medi:segment.name: Date/time/period
medi:segment.medi:documentation: DTM, A segment specifying the contribution start and end dates, and the date of any contribution termination as needed.

medi:segment.name: Free text
medi:segment.medi:documentation:
FTX, A segment for free text information in coded or clear form, to give information on additional attributes if required. Coded text should be used where possible, as the use of clear text may require special processing of the FTX segment information.
4.1.3 Summary section
Information to be provided in the Summary section:

medi:segment.name: Section control
medi:segment.medi:documentation: UNS, A service segment placed at the start of the summary section to avoid segment collision.

medi:segment.name: Monetary amount
medi:segment.medi:documentation: MOA, A segment giving the total amount being paid into the superannuation scheme as specified by this advice.

medi:segment.name: Control total
medi:segment.medi:documentation: CNT, A segment to provide message control totals as required. For example, the total number of individual contribution amounts could be provided. It should be noted that a balancing monetary total is provided by the total amount paid.

medi:segment.name: Authentication result
medi:segment.medi:documentation: AUT, A segment to specify the results of the application of an authentication procedure, enabling to check the authenticity of the sender and the integrity of the data.
